title: Dembele wins FIFA Best men player of the year , Bonmati clinches women award
body_text:
By Web Desk
December 16, 2025
France and Paris Saint-Germain forward Ousmane Dembele has won the FIFA men's player of the year award in Doha on Tuesday at the FIFA Best awards, while Spain and Barcelona midfielder Aitana Bonmati secured the women's award for the third year in a row.
The 28-year-old played a decisive role in PSG’s historic campaign, guiding the club to its first-ever UEFA Champions League title with a stunning 5-0 victory over Inter Milan in last season’s final.
Dembele’s last season was a blockbuster, scoring 35 goals across all competitions, including 21 in Ligue 1 to finish as top scorer.
Under coach Luis Enrique, Dembele flourished, reaching his peak and cementing his status as one of the world’s football elite talents.
He is also the winner of the 2025 Men’s Ballon d’Or, becoming the first French player to lift the prestigious award since Karim Benzema in 2022. He edged out Barcelona’s teenage sensation Lamine Yamal, who finished second, while his PSG teammate Vitinha claimed third place.
Dembele was part of the PSG team, which achieved a historic continental treble in the 2024-2025 season, becoming the first French club to win the UEFA Champions League, domestic league, and the main domestic cup and reached the final of the Club World Cup.
On the other hand, Bonmati, the Champions League player of the season, also clinched the women's Ballon d'Or for the third consecutive time this year, and helped her club Barcelona win the domestic treble, along with reaching the Champions League final.
The 27-year-old was also part of the Spain team, which reached the Euro 2025 final, losing the decider to England on penalties, where she won the Player of the Tournament award.
Sarina Wiegman secured the FIFA best women's coach award for the fifth time, and PSG boss Luis Enrique won the men's coach award.
England and Chelsea's Hannah Hampton won the best women's goalkeeper award, while Italy's Gianluigi Donnarumma lifted the men's keeper award for his role in PSG's treble win.
